subject: Education
title: Prussia's Compulsory Schooling: Education as State Policy
description: Learn Prussia's Compulsory Schooling: Education as State Policy in one minute.

hook.text: In 1763, Prussia told every parent: send your children to school, or face fines.

buildup.text: Frederick the Great wanted literate soldiers and obedient citizens, not free thinkers.

discovery.text: The Prussian model standardized grades, subjects, and teacher training for the first time.

twist.text: America copied this model in the 1800sâ€”and much of it still structures schools today.

climax.text: Compulsory schooling created mass literacy but also mass conformity by design.

punchline.text: The factory model of school was designed for factories.

quiz.question: What was the primary goal of Prussia's compulsory schooling?
options: Creating literate, obedient citizens who could serve the state
